description.para: Calls the AWS Elemental MediaTailor PutPlaybackConfiguration API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Adds a new playback configuration to AWS Elemental MediaTailor.
The identifier for the playback configuration.

The URL for the ad decision server (ADS). This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.

The URL for the ad decision server (ADS) for pre-roll ads. This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing, you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.
The configuration for using a content delivery network (CDN), like Amazon CloudFront, for content and ad segment management.
The maximum allowed duration for the pre-roll ad avail. AWS Elemental MediaTailor won't play pre-roll ads to exceed this duration, regardless of the total duration of ads that the ADS returns.
Sets the mode for avail suppression, also known as ad suppression. By default, ad suppression is off and all ad breaks are filled by MediaTailor with ads or slate.
The maximum duration of underfilled ad time (in seconds) allowed in an ad break.

The URL for a high-quality video asset to transcode and use to fill in time that's not used by ads. AWS Elemental MediaTailor shows the slate to fill in gaps in media content. Configuring the slate is optional for non-VPAID configurations. For VPAID, the slate is required because MediaTailor provides it in the slots that are designated for dynamic ad content. The slate must be a high-quality asset that contains both audio and video.
The tags to assign to the playback configuration.

The name that is used to associate this playback configuration with a custom transcode profile. This overrides the dynamic transcoding defaults of MediaTailor. Use this only if you have already set up custom profiles with the help of AWS Support.
The avail suppression value is a live edge offset time in HH:MM:SS. MediaTailor won't fill ad breaks on or behind this time in the manifest lookback window.
The URL prefix for the master playlist for the stream, minus the asset ID. The maximum length is 512 characters.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PutPlaybackConfigurationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PutPlaybackConfigurationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

The URL for the ad decision server (ADS). This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.
Sets the mode for avail suppression, also known as ad suppression. By default, ad suppression is off and all ad breaks are filled by MediaTailor with ads or slate.
The avail suppression value is a live edge offset time in HH:MM:SS. MediaTailor won't fill ad breaks on or behind this time in the manifest lookback window.
The configuration for using a content delivery network (CDN), like Amazon CloudFront, for content and ad segment management.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

The URL for the ad decision server (ADS) for pre-roll ads. This includes the specification of static parameters and placeholders for dynamic parameters. AWS Elemental MediaTailor substitutes player-specific and session-specific parameters as needed when calling the ADS. Alternately, for testing, you can provide a static VAST URL. The maximum length is 25,000 characters.
The maximum allowed duration for the pre-roll ad avail. AWS Elemental MediaTailor won't play pre-roll ads to exceed this duration, regardless of the total duration of ads that the ADS returns.
The identifier for the playback configuration.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The maximum duration of underfilled ad time (in seconds) allowed in an ad break.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PutPlaybackConfigurationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PutPlaybackConfigurationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

The URL for a high-quality video asset to transcode and use to fill in time that's not used by ads. AWS Elemental MediaTailor shows the slate to fill in gaps in media content. Configuring the slate is optional for non-VPAID configurations. For VPAID, the slate is required because MediaTailor provides it in the slots that are designated for dynamic ad content. The slate must be a high-quality asset that contains both audio and video.
The tags to assign to the playback configuration.

The name that is used to associate this playback configuration with a custom transcode profile. This overrides the dynamic transcoding defaults of MediaTailor. Use this only if you have already set up custom profiles with the help of AWS Support.
The URL prefix for the master playlist for the stream, minus the asset ID. The maximum length is 512 characters.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PutPlaybackConfigurationResponse object containing multiple properties. The object can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS Elemental MediaTailor DeletePlaybackConfiguration API operation.

description.para: Deletes the playback configuration for the specified name.
The identifier for the playback configuration.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.DeletePlaybackConfigurationResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Calls the AWS Elemental MediaTailor UntagResource API operation.

description.para: Removes tags from the specified playback configuration resource. You can specify one or more tags to remove.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the playback configuration. You can get this from the response to any playback configuration request.
A comma-separated list of the tag keys to remove from the playback configuration.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the playback configuration. You can get this from the response to any playback configuration request.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
A comma-separated list of the tag keys to remove from the playback configuration.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.UntagResourceResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Returns a list of the tags assigned to the specified playback configuration resource.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

This cmdlet returns a collection of System.String objects. The service call response (type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS Elemental MediaTailor TagResource API operation.

description.para: Adds tags to the specified playback configuration resource. You can specify one or more tags to add.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the playback configuration. You can get this from the response to any playback configuration request.
A comma-separated list of tag key:value pairs. For example: { "Key1": "Value1", "Key2": "Value2" }

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
A comma-separated list of tag key:value pairs. For example: { "Key1": "Value1", "Key2": "Value2" }

Calls the AWS Elemental MediaTailor ListPlaybackConfigurations API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Returns a list of the playback configurations defined in AWS Elemental MediaTailor. You can specify a maximum number of configurations to return at a time. The default maximum is 50. Results are returned in pagefuls. If MediaTailor has more configurations than the specified maximum, it provides parameters in the response that you can use to retrieve the next pageful.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

Maximum number of records to return.
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned. If a value for this parameter is not specified the cmdlet will use a default value of '20'.

Pagination token returned by the GET list request when results exceed the maximum allowed. Use the token to fetch the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Items'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPlaybackConfigurationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPlaybackConfigurationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Maximum number of records to return.
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned. If a value for this parameter is not specified the cmdlet will use a default value of '20'.

Pagination token returned by the GET list request when results exceed the maximum allowed. Use the token to fetch the next page of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Items'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPlaybackConfigurationsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPlaybackConfigurationsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.PlaybackConfiguration objects. The service call response (type Amazon.MediaTailor.Model.ListPlaybackConfigurationsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
